title: Google Executive Warns US Power Grid Isn't Keeping Up With AI Data Center Expansion, Describes 'Number One Challenge' On The Network
summary: A Google executive has raised concerns that the U.S. power grid is struggling to keep pace with the rapid expansion of AI data centers, citing transmission bottlenecks that can cause years-long delays for grid connections. Google is exploring temporary solutions like colocation, placing data centers next to power plants, while striving for eventual grid integration. The growing energy demand from AI is projected to significantly increase global electricity consumption by 2035.

title: Crescent Biopharma Advances CR-001 Cancer Trial Into First-in-Human Stage
summary: Crescent Biopharma, Inc. (CBIO) has announced the advancement of its CR-001 cancer trial into the first-in-human stage with a Phase 1/2 study. The trial aims to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and antitumor activity of CR-001 in adults with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors. While the study is currently in the "Not Yet Recruiting" phase, this marks a significant value inflection point for the biotech firm, potentially influencing future capital raises or partnerships.

title: Ark de Cathie Wood vende ações da Tesla e compra Broadcom e Klarna
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK ETFs made significant portfolio adjustments on January 14, 2026. The firm sold 86,139 shares of Tesla (TSLA) and 19,310 shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSM), while making substantial purchases of Broadcom Inc (AVGO) and Klarna Group PLC (KLAR). These moves indicate a strategic rebalancing towards fintech and other technology sectors, reducing exposure to established tech giants.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: cathie wood’s ark sells tesla stock, buys broadcom and klarna By Investing.com
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK ETFs executed significant trades on January 14, 2026, selling 86,139 shares of Tesla Inc. worth $38.5 million from its ARKK ETF. Concurrently, ARK made substantial purchases, acquiring 143,089 shares of Broadcom Inc. for $50.7 million across its ARKK and ARKW ETFs, and 56,993 shares of Klarna Group PLC for $1.7 million through its ARKF ETF. These moves indicate a strategic rebalancing towards fintech and other technology sectors, reducing exposure to established tech giants.

title: cathie wood’s ark sells tesla stock, buys broadcom and klarna
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK ETF has sold a significant portion of its Tesla (TSLA) stock, amounting to over $38.5 million, marking a reduction in a long-held staple of its portfolio. Concurrently, ARK made substantial purchases of Broadcom (AVGO) and Klarna (KLAR), investing over $50 million and $1.7 million respectively, indicating a strategic shift towards growth prospects in semiconductors and fintech. These trades highlight ARK's rebalancing strategy, divesting from established tech giants and increasing exposure to evolving market sectors.

title: Stellantis N.V. Is Quietly Eating Detroit’s Lunch – Should You Jump In Now or Nah?
summary: This article analyzes Stellantis N.V. as a potentially undervalued automotive giant that is aggressively pivoting to electric vehicles while its stock remains quiet despite the strong cultural presence of its brands like Jeep, Dodge, and Ram. It discusses the company's EV strategy, brand power, and valuation compared to competitors like Tesla, Ford, and GM, concluding it could be a "cop" for long-term investors seeking value rather than a "meme rocket."

title: EVgo plans 150 fast chargers a year at Kroger stores through 2035
summary: EVgo announced plans to install at least 150 DC fast-charging stalls annually at Kroger Family of Stores locations across the US through 2035, expanding a partnership initiated in 2022. This initiative aims to provide convenient charging options for EV drivers where they shop. The first new site is already operational in Salt Lake City, Utah, with more locations planned across various states and Kroger banners.

title: Waymo rivals Tesla by expanding service area in Austin
summary: Waymo has expanded its driverless ride-hailing service in Austin, now covering 140 square miles, to compete with Tesla's robotaxi service. While Tesla boasts a larger service area of over 245 square miles, Waymo has more active robotaxis on Austin's streets with approximately 200 cars. This expansion is part of Waymo's broader growth strategy, with plans to launch services in several other U.S. cities, including Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio, this year.

title: Tesla puts full self-driving behind a monthly paywall
summary: Tesla has announced that its Full Self-Driving (Supervised) software will transition to a monthly subscription model starting February 14, discontinuing the one-time purchase option. This move, driven in part by a recent shareholder-approved pay package for CEO Elon Musk tied to achieving 10 million FSD subscriptions, coincides with increased competition and scrutiny over the software's capabilities and marketing. The change reflects Tesla's ongoing strategy to monetize its advanced driver-assistance features amidst challenges in its EV market share and robotaxi development.

title: Elon Musk must deliver on Tesla's Robotaxi promise in 2026, Deutsche Bank says
summary: Deutsche Bank analysts believe that 2026 is a crucial year for Tesla to deliver on its Robotaxi promise, especially as the company faces declining car deliveries and questions about its core automotive business. Despite Elon Musk's previous overly optimistic projections and subsequent caution regarding autonomous deployment, investors are expected to focus on Robotaxi expansion and humanoid development to offset weaknesses in auto sales. The article highlights Tesla's struggles in China and Europe and emphasizes that over 90% of its revenue still comes from cars, making the success of Robotaxis critical for future growth and investor confidence.

title: First Tesla Cybertruck Lands in Kenya
summary: The first Tesla Cybertruck has arrived in Kenya as part of a Guinness World Record attempt by the global road expedition team CyberLocos. Adventurers Berni and Alex are driving the Cybertruck across several continents to showcase its endurance and promote clean energy. The vehicle, spotted in Mombasa and Nairobi, has generated significant excitement and speculation among Kenyans.

title: Flying panels to bad glue: Recalls for Tesla's 'indestructible' Cybertruck pile up
summary: Tesla's Cybertruck, advertised as "indestructible," has faced numerous recalls since its late 2023 release, totaling nearly 116,000 vehicles recalled in 2025 alone. Issues have ranged from flying stainless steel panels due to faulty adhesive and dislodging accelerator pads to overly bright headlights and problems with rearview cameras and windshield wipers. Despite the mounting recalls and a 38% drop in sales by Q3 2025, the vehicle maintains a following among loyalists, though Tesla is now focusing on its upcoming Cybercab to boost sales.

title: Empire State Realty stock hits 52-week low at 5.92 USD
summary: Empire State Realty OP LP (ESBA) stock has fallen to a 52-week low of 5.92 USD, representing a 34.62% decrease over the past year. Despite facing a challenging real estate market, the company exhibits strong financial indicators such as a 16% free cash flow yield, an EV/EBITDA multiple of 11.58, and a consistent 13-year dividend payment history with a 2.29% yield. InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock is currently undervalued.

title: NIO stock drops again as EU tariff rethink and China sales slowdown hit sentiment
summary: Nio stock fell by 1.6% due to new signals regarding demand and trade policy impacting electric vehicle stocks. The EU is reconsidering its tariff approach with Chinese EV makers, introducing uncertainty, while China's auto industry projects a significant slowdown in sales growth for 2026, particularly for EVs. Despite these challenges, Nio plans to continue its European expansion, stating that progress is being made between China and the EU on tariff consensus.

title: Tesla reportedly struggling to offload inventory in India amid cancellations By Investing.com
summary: Tesla is reportedly having difficulty selling about one-third of the initial Model Y vehicles imported to India last year, with many early reservation holders canceling orders. This struggle comes as Tesla faces declining global demand and was surpassed by BYD Co. as the top-selling EV manufacturer in 2025. To boost sales in India, where import taxes are high and prices start at nearly $70,000, Tesla is offering discounts of up to 200,000 rupees on certain Model Y variants.

title: Northrop Grumman stock hits all-time high of 641.3 USD
summary: Northrop Grumman Corporation's (NYSE:NOC) stock reached an all-time high of $641.3, an 8.4% gain in the past week and a 35.48% increase over the past year. The company, with a market capitalization of $91.39 billion, has demonstrated strong financial health and investor confidence due to its performance in the defense sector, strategic initiatives, and consistent dividend payments for 55 consecutive years. Recent contract wins for advanced torpedoes and missile defense technologies underscore its market position, though InvestingPro suggests the stock is slightly overvalued.

title: Tesla’s India Letdown Spurs Discounts on Unsold Model Y SUVs
summary: Tesla is reportedly facing sluggish demand for its Model Y SUVs in India, with about a third of its initial imports remaining unsold four months after shipment. This has led the company to offer discounts of up to 200,000 rupees ($2,200) on some variants to clear the inventory. The issue arises as some early bookers have withdrawn their purchases, leaving approximately 100 vehicles without buyers.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights General Motors, Toyota Motor, Ford, Tesla and Stellantis
summary: Despite high vehicle prices and rising financing costs, the U.S. auto industry had a strong 2025 with total sales rising 2% to 16.2 million units, the best year since 2019. General Motors, Toyota Motor, and Ford were the top sellers, while Tesla faced its second consecutive annual delivery decline due to cooling EV demand and increased competition. The industry faces caution in 2026, with projected new-vehicle sales expected to decline, and will be shaped by government policy shifts, a new phase in the EV market, and increased AI integration.

title: What 13.6M U.S. car buyers reveal about Tesla, GM and brand loyalty
summary: S&P Global Mobility announced the winners of its 30th annual Automotive Loyalty Awards, with General Motors securing 'Overall Loyalty to Manufacturer' for the 11th consecutive year and Tesla winning 'Overall Loyalty to Make' for the fourth year. The awards are based on an analysis of 13.6 million new U.S. retail vehicle registrations. The data highlights diverse strategies for customer retention, including product redesigns for models like the Chevrolet Equinox, targeted market appeal for Tesla, and strong dealer performance for Subaru.

title: Tesla Releases 7-Seater Model Y In US As Improved China Sales Provide Boost To Elon Musk's TSLA Amid Delivery Shortfall
summary: Tesla has launched a new 7-seater version of the Model Y crossover SUV in the US, available for an extra $2,500 with the Premium all-wheel-drive trim. This release comes despite a Q4 delivery shortfall, partially offset by record-breaking sales in China for the 6-seater Model Y, which will also be introduced to the European market. The company is also working on expanding its FSD technology in Europe, while investor Gary Black suggests Tesla needs to increase its marketing efforts.

title: National Energy Services Reunited stock hits all-time high at 18.01 USD
summary: National Energy Services Reunited (NESR) stock has reached an all-time high of $18.01, driven by strong investor confidence and robust performance in the energy services sector. Despite the stock being in "overbought territory" according to its RSI, it has shown a 99% increase over the past year, maintaining a healthy 33% return on equity and moderate debt. Recent news includes a new "transformational" unconventional fracturing contract with Saudi Arabia, boosting analyst price targets, even as Q3 2025 earnings fell short of forecasts.

title: (TSL) Volatility Zones as Tactical Triggers
summary: This article analyzes Graniteshares 1.25x Long Tsla Daily Etf (NYSE: TSL), identifying positive near-term sentiment within a long-term strong context, despite a potential mid-term weak bias. It provides specific institutional trading strategies, including long, breakout, and short setups, with defined entry zones, targets, and stop losses. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal strengths and resistance/support levels generated by AI models.

title: Ford Motor Company (F) Plans to Introduce its AV Technology, Here’s What You Need to Know
summary: Ford Motor Company (F) plans to introduce its autonomous driving (AV) technology in its 2028 all-electric vehicles, specifically targeting mainstream models priced around $30,000, starting with a midsize truck by 2027. This strategy aims to differentiate Ford from competitors like Tesla and GM by making AV technology accessible in more affordable cars. Wall Street analysts are bullish on Ford's prospects due to these AV and electric vehicle announcements, with Piper Sandler upgrading the stock and raising its price target.

title: Atai Beckley N.V. (ATAI) is a Buy on Mental Therapeutics Opportunities
summary: Jones Trading has initiated coverage of Atai Beckley N.V. (ATAI) with a Buy rating and a $16 price target, citing the company's differentiated pipeline of psychedelic and empathogenic drugs for neuropsychiatric indications. The firm expects Atai Beckley to benefit from its lead assets, BPL-003 and VLS-01, for resistant depression, a large market with unmet needs. The positive outlook is supported by the company's strengthened balance sheet and advanced clinical programs, including a strategic partnership with Beckley Psytech in next-generation mental health therapeutics.

title: Westwood Wealth Management Boosts Stake in Tesla, Inc. $TSLA
summary: Westwood Wealth Management significantly increased its stake in Tesla, Inc. by 78.4% in Q3, now holding 14,703 shares valued at approximately $6.54 million, making it their 11th largest holding. Despite this institutional confidence and Tesla beating Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, the stock carries a high valuation with a P/E ratio of 298.13 and an average analyst rating of "Hold." Insiders have also sold a substantial amount of shares in the past 90 days.

title: Tesla sales in Canada fell more than 60% in 2025 amid self-inflicted, EV market stumbles
summary: Tesla's Canadian sales dropped by over 60% in 2025, a significant decline attributed to both company-specific issues and broader electric vehicle market challenges. Sales began to recover once Model Y vehicles from Germany, which are not subject to Canadian counter-tariffs on U.S.-built vehicles, started arriving. However, a full rebound to 2024 levels is not expected in the near future.

title: Musk afirma que a Tesla vai encerrar as vendas avulsas do FSD e migrar totalmente para o modelo de assinatura
summary: Elon Musk anunciou que a Tesla deixará de vender o software Full Self-Driving (FSD) como uma compra única a partir de meados de fevereiro de 2026, migrando exclusivamente para um modelo de assinatura mensal. Atualmente, o FSD pode ser adquirido por US$ 8.000 ou por uma assinatura mensal de US$ 99. Esta mudança faz parte da estratégia da Tesla para incentivar uma adoção mais ampla do software e reforça o foco da empresa na condução autônoma e robótica como pilares de seu crescimento futuro.

title: Direxion Daily TSLA Bear 1X Shares (NASDAQ:TSLS) Short Interest Down 53.3% in December
summary: Short interest in Direxion Daily TSLA Bear 1X Shares (TSLS) decreased by 53.3% in December, falling to 1,569,001 shares. The ETF, which provides inverse exposure to Tesla, recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.0495, resulting in a 3.9% annualized yield. Major institutional investors have adjusted their holdings, with several increasing their stakes in TSLS during recent quarters.

title: Tesla rival revs up $9.5M investment in this Texas city
summary: Rivian, an electric vehicle manufacturer and a competitor to Tesla, plans to build a $9.5 million sales and service center in Round Rock, Texas. This expansion follows the opening of its first Texas store in Austin and is set to begin construction in March 2026, with completion expected in March 2027. The new 46,000 square foot facility will bolster Rivian's presence in Texas, adding to its existing operations in other major Texas cities.

title: Cullinan Associates Inc. Acquires 74,405 Shares of PayPal Holdings, Inc. $PYPL
summary: Cullinan Associates Inc. significantly increased its stake in PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) during the third quarter, purchasing an additional 74,405 shares to own a total of 100,220 shares valued at approximately $6.72 million. Despite this institutional buying, PayPal has seen insider selling from executives and mixed analyst sentiment with some recent downgrades, though the company did beat Q3 earnings and revenue estimates and issued positive FY2025 EPS guidance. The article highlights key positive and negative news impacting PayPal, including partnerships and expansion into AI-driven commerce alongside concerns about competitive pressure and trading significantly below its 52-week high.

title: Dan Ives Predicts Tesla Will Own '80%' Of Robotaxi Market — Says TSLA In His Top 5 List For 2026
summary: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities reiterates his bullish outlook on Tesla, predicting the company will dominate 80% of the Robotaxi market by 2026. He places Tesla at the top of his personal list of top five stocks for the year, alongside Microsoft, Apple, Palantir, and CrowdStrike. Ives's prediction comes despite Tesla's Robotaxi service missing previous self-imposed deadlines and the strong performance of competitors like Waymo.

title: Elon Musk Says Tesla Will Stop Selling FSD Post Valentine's Day: 'Only Available As A Monthly Subscription'
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla will discontinue selling its Full Self-Driving (FSD) service as a one-time purchase after February 14th, making it exclusively available through a monthly subscription. Currently, FSD can be purchased for $8,000 or subscribed to for $99/month. This change aims to potentially boost adoption, with competitor Rivian also offering a subscription model for its autonomous driving technology.

title: Tesla, Inc. $TSLA Position Cut by Bristlecone Advisors LLC
summary: Bristlecone Advisors LLC has reduced its holdings in Tesla by 5.3% in the third quarter, selling 1,215 shares and now owning 21,823 shares valued at $9.705 million. This comes amidst other institutional investors either increasing or decreasing their stakes, with overall institutional ownership at 66.20%. Meanwhile, Tesla insiders, including CFO Vaibhav Taneja and Director Kimbal Musk, have also sold shares, totaling 119,457 shares worth $53.5 million over the past ninety days.

title: Tesla driver-assist system FSD will switch to subscription-only — Musk
summary: Tesla will transition its Full Self-Driving (FSD) driver-assistance system to a subscription-only model, as announced by CEO Elon Musk. This change, effective after February 14, eliminates the significant upfront purchase cost, with subscriptions already available for US$99 a month. The move comes as Tesla faces a sales slump and focuses more on its tech initiatives.

title: Tesla to stop selling FSD software, will only offer subscription, Musk says
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla will cease selling its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software after February 14, transitioning to a subscription-only model. Currently, FSD can be purchased for a one-time fee of $8,000 or subscribed to monthly for $99. This move comes as Tesla aims to boost adoption of the FSD service, which, despite its name, requires human supervision.

title: Tesla to offer self-driving software only on monthly basis from Feb 14, Musk says
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced that the company's full self-driving (FSD) software will transition to a monthly subscription-only model starting February 14. Currently, customers can purchase FSD (Supervised) for a one-time payment of $8,000 or subscribe for $99 per month in the U.S. FSD is an assistance system, and the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is investigating 2.88 million Tesla vehicles equipped with it due to safety concerns.

title: Tesla vai parar de vender software FSD e oferecerá apenas assinatura, diz Musk
summary: Elon Musk anunciou que a Tesla Inc. deixará de vender seu software "Full Self-Driving (FSD)" após 14 de fevereiro, passando a oferecê-lo apenas por meio de assinatura mensal. Essa mudança visa, provavelmente, aumentar a adoção do serviço, que atualmente custa US$ 8.000 ou US$ 99 por mês. O FSD, embora promova recursos de condução automatizada, ainda requer intervenção humana e é uma aposta de Musk para impulsionar o crescimento da Tesla em meio à desaceleração nas vendas de veículos elétricos.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos
source_domain: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: EVs Are ‘The End Game,’ GM CEO Mary Barra Says A Day Before Trump's Detroit Visit
summary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra stated that electric vehicles are the "end game" for the company, despite some recent scaling back of EV ambitions due to regulatory changes and the end of tax credits. Her comments were made a day before former President Donald Trump's visit to Detroit, which comes after his administration's policies impacted the EV market. Barra emphasized that while incentives help, the industry will eventually reach an all-EV future and GM may reintroduce hybrids where necessary.

title: Tesla Model Y Emerges As Best-Selling EV In US For 2025 Despite 15% Drop In Q4 Sales — Ford F150 Lightning Edges Out Cybertruck
summary: The Tesla Model Y was the best-selling EV in the US for 2025, despite its Q4 sales dropping 4% compared to 2024, and the Model 3 also saw a significant Q4 decline. Ford's F-150 Lightning outsold the Tesla Cybertruck, becoming the best-selling EV pickup for the year. General Motors showed strong growth in its EV sales, while Rivian's sales declined and Lucid Group's sales increased.

title: Bill Ford: $20 billion EV pivot about ‘recognizing what reality was’
summary: Ford CEO Jim Farley stated that the company is not moving backward on electric vehicles, while Bill Ford commented that the $20 billion EV pivot was about "recognizing what reality was." The article also mentions the F-150 Lightning and its production ending in late 2025.

title: Tesla Inc. (TSLA) Wolfe Research Maintains “Hold” Rating
summary: Wolfe Research has reiterated its "Hold" rating on Tesla (TSLA), citing a balanced risk-reward view despite the company's long-term leadership in EVs. The firm's stance is influenced by concerns over near-term margin pressure due to Tesla prioritizing volume growth and affordability, and intensifying competition in the EV market. Analysts also noted that much of Tesla's long-term potential, including autonomous driving and AI, is already factored into its current share price, with execution risk remaining a key variable.

title: Wall Street sends message on Tesla after Nvidia self-driving move
summary: Despite Nvidia's recent push into autonomy at CES 2026, launching its "Alpamayo" open portfolio for self-driving cars, Morgan Stanley maintains that Tesla still holds a significant lead in autonomous driving. Analyst Andrew Percoco believes Tesla's vast real-world data collection from its fleet gives it a distinct "moat" that competitors, including those utilizing Nvidia's tools, cannot quickly match. While Nvidia's advancements are additive and can speed up advanced driving assistance, they do not represent a near-term turning point that would close the gap with Tesla's extensive experience and data advantage.

title: Tesla Makin Santer Dikabarkan Akan Meluncurkan Mobil Listrik Versi Budget alias Lebih Murah
summary: Tesla is increasingly rumored to be launching a more affordable, budget-friendly version of its electric cars, specifically the Model Y Standard Range. The speculation grew after the budget Model Y briefly appeared on Tesla China's website. These cheaper models, expected to be priced around 200,000 yuan (approximately $28,500), are intended to target lower-price segments while leveraging Tesla's established brand reputation.

title: How Do the 2027 BMW iX3 and 2027 Mercedes-Benz GLC With EQ Technology Compare?
summary: The 2027 BMW iX3 and 2027 Mercedes-Benz GLC With EQ Technology, both unveiled at CES 2026, represent distinct approaches to the next generation of electric luxury SUVs. The iX3 prioritizes a "rolling smartphone" experience with its advanced OSX operating system and Panoramic Vision display, focusing on digital architecture and user interaction. In contrast, the GLC EQ offers a more characterful and elegant interior design, an updated MBUX system with an optional Hyperscreen, and a focus on entertainment and productivity apps. While the iX3 leads in charging speed, the GLC EQ offers slightly more horsepower, making the choice dependent on individual priorities for tech versus interior aesthetics.

title: Automobile Manufacturing Stocks Q3 In Review: Autoliv (NYSE:ALV) Vs Peers
summary: This article reviews the Q3 earnings of several automobile manufacturing stocks, including Autoliv (NYSE:ALV), Ford (NYSE:F), Lucid (NASDAQ:LCID), Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA), and General Motors (NYSE:GM). It highlights Autoliv's strong performance, Ford's exceptional quarter, Lucid's disappointing results, Tesla's satisfactory quarter with a revenue beat, and General Motors' incredible quarter. The report emphasizes the high barriers to entry in auto manufacturing but notes the disruption caused by electric vehicles and the varying success of companies in adapting to these changes.

title: Broadcom Stock Just Went Wild: Is AVGO the Next Must-Cop Chip King or Peak Hype?
summary: This article analyzes Broadcom (AVGO) stock, questioning if it's an essential investment in the chip industry or merely overhyped. It positions Broadcom as a less flashy but fundamentally strong player in AI and cloud infrastructure, combining chip manufacturing with enterprise software. The text compares AVGO to competitors like Nvidia and AMD, highlighting Broadcom's cash generation, dividends, and diversified business model as key strengths for long-term investors.

title: Tesla Reintroduces Third-Row Seat in Model Y
summary: Tesla has brought back the third-row seat option for its Model Y, specifically for the all-wheel-drive Premium trim, which is a $2,500 add-on. This reintroduction addresses a feature that was removed during the Model Y's refresh last year. Despite the added cost, the Model Y remains the most affordable three-row electric vehicle available, now capable of seating up to seven occupants.

title: Strive Secures Landmark Approval for Semler Scientific Acquisition, Skyrocketing Bitcoin Holdings to 12,798 BTC
summary: U.S. asset manager Strive has received shareholder approval to acquire Semler Scientific, a Nasdaq-listed medical technology firm. This acquisition will increase Strive's Bitcoin holdings from 7,750 BTC to 12,798 BTC, making it one of the largest corporate crypto acquisitions of the year. The move highlights a growing trend of traditional finance entities using strategic mergers to gain exposure to digital assets and solidifies Bitcoin's role as a legitimate treasury asset.

title: If You Own Lucid Stock, Take a Look at This Durable Stock Instead
summary: This article suggests that investors holding Lucid (LCID) stock should consider selling it due to the company's struggles with EV headwinds and declining value. Instead, the author recommends investing in Walmart (WMT), highlighting its steady growth, market durability, and strong financial performance as a safer and more reliable alternative for long-term returns. Walmart's vast retail presence and ability to weather economic slowdowns are presented as key advantages over Lucid's speculative nature.

title: Trump visits a Ford pickup truck factory, aiming to promote his efforts to boost manufacturing
authors: Will Weissert and Corey Williams | The Associated Press
summary: President Donald Trump visited a Ford F-150 factory in Michigan to highlight his administration's efforts to boost U.S. manufacturing and address concerns about the economy. This visit was part of a series of trips to swing states aimed at promoting his economic policies, despite recent Republican losses in off-year elections and persistent public concerns about inflation. Trump discussed tariffs, trade agreements, and recent positive inflation data, while critics, including Michigan Democrats, accused him of promoting a "billionaire-first agenda."
